[[Image:WeaponsInspector.JPG|thumb|right|250px|A UN weapons inspector in Iraq.]]
On March 12 2003, [[Tony Blair]] and [[Jack Straw (politician)|Jack Straw]] proposed a draft resolution to the [[United Nations]]. If the demands for disarmament were met by 17 March, it was suggested that military action would be averted and Saddam Hussein allowed to remain in power.
On March 12 2003, [[Tony Blair]] and [[Jack Straw (politician)|Jack Straw]] proposed a draft resolution to the [[United Nations]]. If the demands for disarmament were met by 17 March, it was suggested that military action would be averted and Saddam Hussein allowed to remain in power.
